intro: Heliotropium euodes, commonly known as the sweet shrub, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 3 meters, featuring woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. The plant's botanical characteristics make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
